intro: Astronia gracilis, commonly known as the slender astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests. Astronia gracilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
